qas.question: To whom was Mary dedicated while still in the womb?
What is understood to be the Holy of Holies in Islam?
Where did Mary reside in her chilhood?
What did God provide for Mary?
Who did Mary reside in the Temple with?
Who gave Mary unique access to Al-Mihrab?
Who dedicated Mary to Allah while she still in her mother's womb?

context: She is the only woman directly named in the Qur'an; declared (uniquely along with Jesus) to be a Sign of God to humanity; as one who "guarded her chastity"; an obedient one; chosen of her mother and dedicated to <a0_0><b6_0>Allah<b6_0/><a0_0/> whilst still in the womb; uniquely (amongst women) Accepted into service by God; cared for by (one of the prophets as per Islam) <a1_0><b5_0><b8_0>Zakariya<b8_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> (Zacharias); that in her childhood she resided <b9_0>in <a3_0>the Temple<b9_0/><a3_0/> and uniquely had access to <a2_0>Al-Mihrab<a2_0/> (understood to be the Holy of Holies), and was provided with <a4_0>heavenly "provisions"<a4_0/> by <b7_0>God<b7_0/>.
